page.title: 12CRICKET CLUB
page.content: Founded early 20C. The ground, which is still used today, was provided by the Maryon-Wilson family of Fitzjohns. First President was Revd John Maryon-Wilson. Originally club members also played football during the winter against other local villages. The old brick-built clubroom has been replaced by a modern licenced clubhouse and the grounds are now leased on a 99 year tenancy. Since l980 a single wicket competition has been held annually in which club members compete against each other. The Maryon-Wilson cup is awarded to the winner (see photo No.3 - Lady Janet Maryon-Wilson presents cup to Paul Short). The Club is the only social meeting place in the village since the closing of The Griffin public house (now The Grange - a private house) in the l920s.
